   20: -module(logger_simple_h_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -compile(export_all).
   23: 
   24: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   25: -include_lib("stdlib/include/assert.hrl").
   26: -include_lib("kernel/include/logger.hrl").
   27: -include_lib("kernel/src/logger_internal.hrl").
   28: 
   29: -import(logger_test_lib, [setup/2, log/3, sync_and_read/3]).
   30: 
   31: -define(check_no_log,[] = test_server:messages_get()).
   32: -define(check(Expected),
   33:         receive {log,Expected} ->
   34:                 [] = test_server:messages_get()
   35:         after 1000 ->
   36:                 ct:fail({report_not_received,
   37:                          {line,?LINE},
   38:                          {expected,Expected},
   39:                          {got,test_server:messages_get()}})
   40:         end).
   41: 
   42: -define(str,"Log from "++atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME)++
   43:             ":"++integer_to_list(?LINE)).
   44: -define(map_rep,#{function=>?FUNCTION_NAME, line=>?LINE}).
   45: -define(keyval_rep,[{function,?FUNCTION_NAME}, {line,?LINE}]).
   46: 
   47: suite() ->
   48:     [{timetrap,{seconds,30}}].
   49: 
   50: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   51:     os:internal_init_cmd_shell(),
   52:     Hs0 = logger:get_handler_config(),
   53:     Hs = lists:keydelete(cth_log_redirect,1,Hs0),
   54:     [ok = logger:remove_handler(Id) || {Id,_,_} <- Hs],
   55:     Env = [{App,Key,application:get_env(App,Key)} ||
   56:               {App,Key} <- [{kernel,logger_level}]],
   57:     [{env,Env},{logger,Hs}|Config].
   58: 
   59: end_per_suite(Config) ->
   60:     [application:set_env(App,Key,Val) || {App,Key,Val} <- ?config(env,Config)],
   61:     Hs = ?config(logger,Config),
   62:     [ok = logger:add_handler(Id,Mod,C) || {Id,Mod,C} <- Hs],
   63:     ok.
   64: 
   65: init_per_group(_Group, Config) ->
   66:     Config.
   67: 
   68: end_per_group(_Group, _Config) ->
   69:     ok.
   70: 
   71: init_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
   72:     Config.
   73: 
   74: end_per_testcase(Case, Config) ->
   75:     try apply(?MODULE,Case,[cleanup,Config])
   76:     catch error:undef -> ok
   77:     end,
   78:     ok.
   79: 
   80: groups() ->
   81:     [].
   82: 
   83: all() -> 
   84:     [start_stop,
   85:      start_debug,
   86:      start_crash,
   87:      replace_default,
   88:      replace_file,
   89:      replace_disk_log
   90:     ].
   91: 
   92: start_stop(_Config) ->
   93:     undefined = whereis(logger_simple_h),
   94:     register(logger_simple_h,self()),
   95:     {error,_} = logger:add_handler(simple,
   96:                                    logger_simple_h,
   97:                                    #{filter_default=>log}),    
   98:     unregister(logger_simple_h),
   99:     ok = logger:add_handler(simple,logger_simple_h,#{filter_default=>log}),
  100:     Pid = whereis(logger_simple_h),
  101:     true = is_pid(Pid),
  102:     ok = logger:remove_handler(simple),
  103:     false = is_pid(whereis(logger_simple_h)),
  104:     ok.
  105: start_stop(cleanup,_Config) ->
  106:     logger:remove_handler(simple).
  107: 
  108: %% Test that the simple logger works when debug level is used
  109: start_debug(Config) ->
  110: 
  111:     ConfigFile = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config), "sys.config"),
  112:     LogFile = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config), "file.log"),
  113:     SysConfig = [{kernel,[{logger,[{handler,default,logger_std_h,
  114:                                     #{config => #{file => LogFile}}}]}]}],
  115:     ok = file:write_file(ConfigFile, io_lib:format("~p.",[SysConfig])),
  116: 
  117:     Run =
  118:         fun(Args) ->
  119:                 CmdLine =
  120:                     lists:flatten(
  121:                       [ct:get_progname(), " ", Args,
  122:                        " -config ", filename:rootname(ConfigFile),  " -noshell -s init stop"]),
  123:                 "" = os:cmd(CmdLine),
  124:                 {ok, Bin} = file:read_file(LogFile),
  125:                 Bin
  126:         end,
  127: 
  128:     Output = Run(""),
  129:     LogOutput = re:replace(unicode:characters_to_binary(Output),"\r\n","\n",[global]),
  130:     ct:log("~ts",[LogOutput]),
  131:     nomatch = re:run(LogOutput,"^=PROGRESS REPORT====",[global,multiline]),
  132: 
  133:     InfoOutput = Run("-kernel logger_level info"),
  134:     InfoLogOutput = re:replace(unicode:characters_to_binary(InfoOutput),"\r\n","\n",[global]),
  135:     ct:log("~ts",[InfoLogOutput]),
  136:     {match,InfoNumReports} = re:run(InfoLogOutput,"^=PROGRESS REPORT====",[global,multiline]),
  137: 
  138:     %% Test that more progress reports are logged for info than default
  139:     ?assert(0 < length(InfoNumReports)),
  140: 
  141:     DebugOutput = Run("-kernel logger_level debug"),
  142:     DebugLogOutput = re:replace(unicode:characters_to_binary(DebugOutput),"\r\n","\n",[global]),
  143:     ct:log("~ts",[DebugLogOutput]),
  144:     {match,DebugNumReports} = re:run(DebugLogOutput,"^=PROGRESS REPORT====",[global,multiline]),
  145: 
  146:     %% Test that more progress reports are logged for debug than info
  147:     ?assert(length(InfoNumReports) < length(DebugNumReports)),
  148: 
  149:     ok.
  150: 
  151: %% Test that the simple logger works during startup crash
  152: start_crash(_Config) ->
  153: 
  154:     Output = os:cmd(ct:get_progname() ++ " -user baduser"),
  155:     ErrorOutput = re:replace(unicode:characters_to_binary(Output),"\r\n","\n",[global]),
  156:     ct:log("~ts",[ErrorOutput]),
  157:     {match,[_]} = re:run(ErrorOutput,"(^=SUPERVISOR REPORT====| supervisor_report *\n)",[global,multiline]),
  158:     {match,[_, _]} = re:run(ErrorOutput," crash_report *\n",[global]),
  159:     {match,[_]} = re:run(ErrorOutput," std_info *\n",[global]),
  160:     {match,[[CD]]} = re:run(ErrorOutput,"\nCrash dump is being written to: (.*)\\.\\.\\.done",
  161:                             [{capture, all_but_first, binary}, global]),
  162:     ok = file:delete(CD),
  163:     ok.
  164: 
  165: 
  166: %% This testcase just tests that it does not crash, the default handler prints
  167: %% to stdout which we cannot read from in a detached slave.
  168: replace_default(Config) ->
  169: 
  170:     {ok, _, Peer, Node} = logger_test_lib:setup(Config, [{logger, [{handler, default, undefined}]}]),
  171:     log(Node, emergency, [?str]),
  172:     log(Node, alert, [?str,[]]),
  173:     log(Node, error, [?map_rep]),
  174:     log(Node, info, [?keyval_rep]),
  175:     log(Node, info, [?keyval_rep++[not_key_val]]),
  176:     rpc:call(Node, error_logger, error_report, [some_type,?map_rep]),
  177:     rpc:call(Node, error_logger, warning_report, ["some_type",?map_rep]),
  178:     log(Node, critical, [?str,[?keyval_rep]]),
  179:     log(Node, notice, [["fake",string,"line:",?LINE]]),
  180: 
  181:     ok = rpc:call(Node, logger, add_handlers, [kernel]),
  182: 
  183:     ok = peer:stop(Peer).
  184: 
  185: replace_file(Config) ->
  186: 
  187:     {ok, _, Peer, Node} = logger_test_lib:setup(Config, [{logger, [{handler, default, undefined}]}]),
  188:     log(Node, emergency, [M1=?str]),
  189:     log(Node, alert, [M2=?str,[]]),
  190:     log(Node, error, [?map_rep]),
  191:     log(Node, warning, [?keyval_rep]),
  192:     log(Node, warning, [?keyval_rep++[not_key_val]]),
  193:     log(Node, critical, [?str,[?keyval_rep]]),
  194:     log(Node, notice, [["fake",string,"line:",?LINE]]),
  195: 
  196:     File = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
  197:                          atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME)++".log"),
  198: 
  199:     ok = rpc:call(Node, logger, add_handlers,
  200:                   [[{handler, default, logger_std_h,
  201:                      #{ config => #{ type => {file, File} },
  202:                         formatter => {?DEFAULT_FORMATTER,?DEFAULT_FORMAT_CONFIG}}}]]),
  203: 
  204:     {ok,Bin} = sync_and_read(Node, file, File),
  205:     Lines = [unicode:characters_to_list(L) ||
  206:                 L <- binary:split(Bin,<<"\n">>,[global,trim])],
  207:     ["=EMERGENCY REPORT===="++_,
  208:      M1,
  209:      "=ALERT REPORT===="++_,
  210:      M2,
  211:      "=ERROR REPORT===="++_,
  212:      _,
  213:      _,
  214:      "=WARNING REPORT===="++_,
  215:      _,
  216:      _,
  217:      "=WARNING REPORT===="++_,
  218:      _,
  219:      _,
  220:      _,
  221:      "=CRITICAL REPORT===="++_,
  222:      _,
  223:      _,
  224:      "=NOTICE REPORT===="++_,
  225:      _
  226:     ] = Lines,
  227:     ok = peer:stop(Peer).
  228: 
  229: replace_disk_log(Config) ->
  230: 
  231:     {ok, _, Peer, Node} = logger_test_lib:setup(Config, [{logger, [{handler, default, undefined}]}]),
  232:     log(Node, emergency, [M1=?str]),
  233:     log(Node, alert, [M2=?str,[]]),
  234:     log(Node, error, [?map_rep]),
  235:     log(Node, warning, [?keyval_rep]),
  236:     log(Node, warning, [?keyval_rep++[not_key_val]]),
  237:     log(Node, critical, [?str,[?keyval_rep]]),
  238:     log(Node, notice, [["fake",string,"line:",?LINE]]),
  239: 
  240:     File = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
  241:                          atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME)++".log"),
  242: 
  243:     ok = rpc:call(Node, logger, add_handlers,
  244:                   [[{handler, default, logger_disk_log_h,
  245:                      #{ config => #{ file => File },
  246:                         formatter => {?DEFAULT_FORMATTER,?DEFAULT_FORMAT_CONFIG}}}]]),
  247:     {ok,Bin} = sync_and_read(Node, disk_log, File),
  248:     Lines = [unicode:characters_to_list(L) ||
  249:                 L <- binary:split(Bin,<<"\n">>,[global,trim])],
  250:     ["=EMERGENCY REPORT===="++_,
  251:      M1,
  252:      "=ALERT REPORT===="++_,
  253:      M2,
  254:      "=ERROR REPORT===="++_,
  255:      _,
  256:      _,
  257:      "=WARNING REPORT===="++_,
  258:      _,
  259:      _,
  260:      "=WARNING REPORT===="++_,
  261:      _,
  262:      _,
  263:      _,
  264:      "=CRITICAL REPORT===="++_,
  265:      _,
  266:      _,
  267:      "=NOTICE REPORT===="++_,
  268:      _
  269:     ] = Lines,
  270:     ok = peer:stop(Peer).
